item.title: Inner Engineering
item.content:encoded:
Inner Engineering by Jaggi Vasudev (Sadhguru)

Yet another introduction to "Yoga" (the real yoga, not what you get to typically see on social media). Gentle introduction to yogic methods to "internally" "engineer" your"self".

item.title: Unlimited Memory
item.content:encoded:
Unlimited Memory by Kevin Horsley

Simple, easy, fun techniques/mental tools to improve memory. We have "bad memory" not because we have bad memory but because of a general lack of "indexing" of the memory - understand how you can leverage multivariate indexing to make stronger neurological connections (akin to improved memory) using real world scenarios.

item.title: Body Language: The Bible (3 book set)
item.content:encoded:
Body Language: The Bible (3 book set) by Brian Hall

Window into the human physio-psyche. Intricacies and workings of body language, dark psychology & manipulation and the possibilities.

item.title: The Truth
item.content:encoded:
The Truth by Neil Strauss

A pickup artist's tryst & frustrations with monogamy. An emotional roller coaster, sure to induce jealousy is most sane men, and disgust in every woman who read this. (Why?)

item.title: A Mind for Numbers
item.content:encoded:
A Mind for Numbers by Barbara Oakley

The process of learning+understanding demystified in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) context. Intellectual and lifestyle tools and processes to learn better. (A book that is based on "learning how to learn" course on Coursera)

item.title: Death: An Inside Story
item.content:encoded:
Death: An Inside Story by Jaggi Vasudev (Sadhguru)

Understanding the concept of "death" in the several dimensions it belongs to, in a largely human context.

item.title: Polymath
item.content:encoded:
Polymath by Peter Hollins

What/who is a Polymath? Why should you consider be one, How can you be one?

item.title: The Battle for Sanskrit
item.content:encoded:
The Battle for Sanskrit by Rajiv Malhotra

The blatant attacks on a beautiful language in the guise of "reviving" it, in the academic sphere after killing it in the public sphere. What are the hidden motives behind such attacks, what is the agenda?

item.title: Art of Possibility
item.content:encoded:
Art of Possibility by Rosamund Stone Zander & Benjamin Zander

A decently articulated, music themed perspective of a music conductor of how to improve your life. A bit tangential at times but well articulated otherwise and written in an anecdotal fashion;demonstrated via a collection of stories

item.title: Zen: The Art of Simple Living
item.content:encoded:
Zen: The Art of Simple Living by Shunmyo Masumo

Zen. ...

item.title: Steal the Show
item.content:encoded:
Steal the Show by Michael Port

A good primer to the anatomy of ovation worthy speeches, bone tickling jokes, heartwarming stories and their application. Presents a collection of tools to improve speech encompassing various levels, scopes and verbal cues.

item.title: The Red Queen
item.content:encoded:
The Red Queen by Matt Ridley

Found yourself attracted to a member of the opposite sex (or same if you swing that way) sex? Find out why, in painfully amazing detail. A truly eye opening take and analysis on sex, viruses (or parasites in general), immunity, evolution and their mechanics, purpose and interdependence.

item.title: Ikigai: The Japanese Secret to a Long and Happy Life
item.content:encoded:
Ikigai: The Japanese Secret to a Long and Happy Life by Albert Liebermann & Hector Garcia

Ikigai - the thing that makes you get up off your bed every morning and fuels your life. Ikigai = Mission + Passion + Vocation + Profession; Quick read to help you find your Ikigai.

item.title: Essentialism
item.content:encoded:
Essentialism by Greg McKeown

Essentialism as a philosophy somewhere in between minimalism and extravagance. Generic methods, almost bordering on cliche, to, subjectively, declutter and add synergistic structure to life.

item.title: Spark: How exercise will improve the performance of your brain
item.content:encoded:
Spark: How exercise will improve the performance of your brain by John Ratey & Eric Hagerman

Postulating exercise as a, limitless-esque (the movie), super pill. Research backed commentry on exercise; carting through the various avenues of benefits it ushers.

item.title: 9 Steps to Keep the Doctor Away
item.content:encoded:
9 Steps to Keep the Doctor Away by Rashid Buttar

An alternate take on modern medicine, sprinkled with legitimate content but mostly fluff. Meanders briefly into philosophy treading dangerously close into pseudoscience.

item.title: The 4-hour Work Week
item.content:encoded:
The 4-hour Work Week by Tim Ferriss

Ideas and tools to negotiate your 9-5, create/build an enterprise, put your money to work. Live life "like" a millionaire.

item.title: Endure: Mind, Body, and the Curiously Elastic Limits of Human Performance
item.content:encoded:
Endure: Mind, Body, and the Curiously Elastic Limits of Human Performance by Alex Hutchinson

A sojourn through the variables that are responsible for "endurance" of the human physiology. Identifying the limits of human physical abilities and exploring/venturing beyond, resulting in some pretty surprising conclusions.

item.title: Deep Work
item.content:encoded:
Deep Work by Cal Newport

Perceiving productivity as a function of the density of work (deep work = high density, shallow work = low density, expressed based on the compressibility of work). Methods and approaches of deliberately increasing the aforementioned deep work.

item.title: So Good they Can't Ignore You
item.content:encoded:
So Good they Can't Ignore You by Cal Newport

Craftsman mindset vs following passion mindset. Counterintuitive approach to actually following your passion - questioning whether "passions" are set in stone or malleable.

item.title: The Drunkard's Walk: How Randomness Rules our Lives
item.content:encoded:
The Drunkard's Walk: How Randomness Rules our Lives by Leonard Mlodinow

An ode to statistics and probability in everyday life. Grokking numbers, probabilities (priors, posteriors) from first principles and concluding in an amalgamation of chaos theory and the butterfly effect titled "the Drunkards walk".

item.title: 12 Rules for Life
item.content:encoded:
12 Rules for Life by Jordan Peterson

A manual for how to progress in life. Rules/guidelines extracted from psychoanalysis of the Bible and other fairy tales.

item.title: Confidence
item.content:encoded:
Confidence by Martin Meadows

A short read on self efficacy. Processes and paths to self efficacy.

item.title: The Productivity Project
item.content:encoded:
The Productivity Project by Chris Bailey

Deconstructing productivity, procrastination and their relationship. Carving a path to productivity navigating through procrastination (and other tools).

item.title: Eat That Frog
item.content:encoded:
Eat That Frog by Brian Tracy

Procrastination demystified. Eat that frog - your frog;the biggest frog first.

item.title: Manipulation Techniques
item.content:encoded:
Manipulation Techniques by Dale J. Rucker

Manipulation: techniques and defences. A short guide.

item.title: The Rational Optimist
item.content:encoded:
The Rational Optimist by Matt Ridley

A sojourn through the socio-politico-ecnomico-cultural dynamics of the world and its co-influence on rational thought, its complexities and costs. The evolutionary origins of rationality contributing to the "human experience", and other systems such as the barter system (observing it's absence in the animal kingdom) - discussing it as a possible "emergent" property of homo sapiens aka a "collective intelligence".

item.title: minimalism
item.content:encoded:
Outliers by Malcolm Gladwell

Minimalism. Declutter, fulfilled life.

item.title: Never Split the Difference
item.content:encoded:
Never Split the Difference by Chris Voss

Negotiation: How to talk yourself into getting what you want. How to lead the other person to talk themselves into giving you what you want and have them think it was their idea to begin with.

item.title: What It Takes
item.content:encoded:
What It Takes by Stephen Schwarzman

What is "success"?, What does it take to be "successful"?, How is "money" involved? Answers to these questions presented in an autobiographical format.

item.title: Rich Dad, Poor Dad
item.content:encoded:
Rich Dad, Poor Dad by Robert Kiyosaki

The things nobody taught you about money, or learnt the hard way presented in an easy read. Read to get the prerequisite financial literacy to better manage money and make more of it.

item.title: The Art of Seduction
item.content:encoded:
The Art of Seduction by Robert Greene

What is "seduction"? What does it mean to "seduce"? Understand the actors, principles and mechanics of seduction: a detailed, comprehensive study with examples.

item.title: Dark Psychology Mastery Secrets (3 in 1)
item.content:encoded:
Dark Psychology Mastery Secrets (3 in 1) by Robert Peterson

A stroll down the dark lane of psychology (dark psychology): manipulation, persuasion, mind-control, brain-washing and more. A densely packed series with acts, principles, explanations and defences; NOT a "How-to" guide.

item.title: NLP: The Essential Guide to Neuro-Linguistic Programming
item.content:encoded:
NLP: The Essential Guide to Neuro-Linguistic Programming by Tom Dotz

How does the mind "perceive" the "reality"? How does it "process" it? Is there a "framework", an "operating system" of the brain? Understand how to "hack" the "data processing cycle" of the brain!

item.title: The Cube: Keep the Secret
item.content:encoded:
The Cube: Keep the Secret by Annie Gottlieb

A Landscape, a Cube, Flowers, a Horse and a Storm. What do they all mean?

item.title: The Mystery Method
item.content:encoded:
The Mystery Method by Eric Von Markovic a.k.a "Mystery"

A framework, a guide, an algorithm, a system and an introduction to the Venusian arts. For AFCs to OPEN SETS, drop DHVs & Negs prior to setting up FTCs to receive IOIs/IODs employing QUALIFIERS, LOCK-INs and PEACOCKING to become PUAs and eventually a PUG.

item.title: Predictably Irrational
item.content:encoded:
Predictably Irrational by Dan Ariely

A seminal analysis of our "decision making systems" - it's components, it's functions, factors that can influence it. The decisions we make (and term) as "rational" - are they truly rational or is there more to it?

item.title: Everything is F*cked
item.content:encoded:
Everything is F*cked by Mark Manson

A natural follow up to "The subtle art of not giving a f*ck", an attempt to destructure deeply entrenched psychological notions/ideologies for analysis. Psychological phenomena elucidated in simple language using conducive analogies.

item.title: The Intellegent Investor
item.content:encoded:
The Intellegent Investor by Benjamin Graham

A mini-3XX course on investing and the stock market; provides a framework for investing "intelligently" (author was Warren Buffett's mentor). An arduous read - assumes the fundamentals to be already understood by the reader, nevertheless a must read prior to investing

item.title: The Game
item.content:encoded:
The Game by Neil Strauss

The journey of a social "nobody" to becoming, arguably, one of the greatest pickup artists of the world, encompassing a despicable start, modest progressions, hitting the peak, spiralling out of control, facing the consequences, and more. Social engineering + understanding the individual's psyche from a dual (generic & evolutionary) perspective + brain hacks = Pickup artistry demystified.

item.title: Chanakya Neeti
item.content:encoded:
Chanakya Neeti by Chanakya translated by R.P. Jain

A compilation of glorious Indic wisdom delivered in a prosaic structure from the genius mind of Chanakya. Although, cluttered with shoddy mistranslations of the original Sanskrit writing and requiring some effort to map ideas to the contemporary world/society.

item.title: Do it Today
item.content:encoded:
Do it Today by Darius Foroux

Deconstruct procrastination to understand its components. Learn the tools - some powered by stoicism, why they work and how they work and develop a multi-pronged approach to engineer your way out of procrastination.

item.title: The Fault in Our Stars
item.content:encoded:
The Fault in Our Stars by John Green

Love: How does it spark? How does it thrive? What nurtures it and causes it to bloom - in seemingly arduous circumstances? How does it end? Does it really have an end? Answers to these questions delivered in a heartwarming love story.

item.title: Outliers
item.content:encoded:
Outliers by Malcolm Gladwell

What are the hidden variables that are responsible for the success/failure of 'anomalies'/outliers in any walk of life? A collection of case studies; hidden variable analyses of these 'outliers'.

item.title: Hello World
item.content:encoded:
Hello

World

item.title: On the shortness of Life
item.content:encoded:
On the shortness of Life by Lucius Seneca

A reality check in a quick but dense read. Brief introductions to Stoicism.

item.title: The Aesthetic Brain: How we evolved to desire beauty and enjoy art
item.content:encoded:
The Aesthetic Brain: How we evolved to desire beauty and enjoy art by Anjan Chatterjee

What does it mean to have an "aesthetic experience" (aka रस - "rasa")? [what makes flowers "beautiful"?, why is the sight of mountains pleasing?,]. Understand it's (it = aesthetic experience) various tenets - music, smell, taste, sex, sight, etc from an evolutionary, neurological perspective.

item.title: Man's Search for Meaning
item.content:encoded:
Man's Search for Meaning by Viktor Frankl

What does it mean to truly live life? What gives it it's meaning? A window into the effects of the holocaust from a psychological point-of-view; also, "logotherapy".

item.title: What To Say When You Talk To Yourself
item.content:encoded:
What To Say When You Talk To Yourself by Shad Helmstetter

The human physiology is the hardware and 'we' write it's software. Learn one of its many programming languages - "self talk", to take advantage of your brain's neuroplasticity and supercharge your life!

item.title: The 5AM Club - Own your morning, Elevate your life
item.content:encoded:
The 5AM Club - Own your morning, Elevate your life by Robin Sharma

Find out what can potentially get unlocked for you just by making a choice to wake up at 5AM. Just by waking up at 5AM, you're already in the top <1% of the population!

item.title: The Rudest Book Ever
item.content:encoded:
The Rudest Book Ever by Shwetanb Gangwar

A collection of harsh truths of life, aimed at the readers ego, written to a contemporary, mostly-male audience, in a conversational style taking a no-nonsense, no-holds-barred approach. A perfect book for anyone (~<25) in a transitory phase of life.

item.title: Meditations
item.content:encoded:
Meditations by Marcus Aurelius

A collection of notes in a pithy paragraph style written in old English encompassing the essence and soul of stoicism. Stoicism - the beautiful philosophy which finds its roots in the Bhagavad Gita.

item.title: Consciousness and the brain
item.content:encoded:
Consciousness and the brain by Stanislas Dehaene

What is consciousness? What is unconsciousness? What can they do? Where is the distinction between them? Who/what sits in the throne of the mind? What did evolution do to it? Understand the answers to these questions elucidated from a neurological POV as you, humorously, develop trust issues with your brain!

item.title: Arise, awake, know your strength
item.content:encoded:
Arise, awake, know your strength by Swami Vivekananda

Who is a youth? What need to be the goals? How can they be achieved? Answers from a vedantic perspective presented as a handbook. A treasure trove of inspiration, motivation and rejuvenation encompassed (within).

item.title: Raja Yoga
item.content:encoded:
Raja Yoga by Swami Vivekananda

Introduction to a "type" of yoga (not yoga-asana, which has become synonymous with yoga these days) which focuses on the psychic (mind) abilities of the "self". Learn the methods, practises and processes that alleviate your mental/intellectual (and physical to a certain extent) abilities to superhuman levels, simultaneously realising there are more important goals to be pursued.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence: a beginner's guide
item.content:encoded:
Artificial Intelligence: a beginner's guide by Blay Whitby

What is intelligence? What is artificial intelligence? How can AI do the things it does and why can't it do the things it can't? A gentle introduction to AI.

item.title: Deep thinking : Where Machine Intelligence Ends And Human Creativity Begins
item.content:encoded:
Deep Thinking : Where Machine Intelligence Ends And Human Creativity Begins by Garry Kasparov

Garry Kasparov takes the reader through a journey through the events that led to the development of "Deep Mind" - a chess program, which he eventually lost to. Simultaneously giving a commentary on the possibilities and proposed limitations of artificial intelligence, machine learning and human creativity!

item.title: The Art of the Good Life
item.content:encoded:
The Art of the Good Life by Rolf Dobelli

A collection of mental tools forged from the mines of modern psychology, stoicism and the philosophy of value investing, to nourish ones life; to make it a "good life". A classical life philosophy for the 21st century.

item.title: The God delusion
item.content:encoded:
The God delusion by Richard Dawkins

Why is God? (A hint of Drax in that question) Understanding the origins, consequences and the supposed requirements for the "existence" of supernatural entities viz-a-viz Gods (and Religions)

item.title: The Idiot Brain
item.content:encoded:
The Idiot Brain by Dean Burnett

Millions of years of evolution has filled our brains with genetic junk (evolutionary byproducts) which we never got rid of. Understand how we are dealing with it despite being partially, obliquely oblivious to it.

item.title: The Magic of Reality
item.content:encoded:
The Magic of Reality by Richard Dawkins

What is magic? What is reality? A biologist-atheist's commentary on how science ties the two.

item.title: The Emperor's New Mind
item.content:encoded:
The Emperor's New Mind by Roger Penrose

A rigorous, mind-bending arduous journey encompassing a path through Turing machines, algorithms & computability, black holes, Hilbert spaces, Mandelbrot sets, quantum mechanics, brains, consciousness reducing down to an attempt at understanding and speculating the non-algorithmic nature of the mind. Remarkably raises more questions than answered that one feels compelled to ponder about.

item.title: The Master Algorithm
item.content:encoded:
The Master Algorithm by Pedro Domingos

Identify the 5 tribes of machine learning research. Attempt to blend them into one (to rule them all?).

item.title: Superintelligence
item.content:encoded:
Superintelligence by Nick Bostrom

Possible paths, measures to singularity (AI). SWOT analysis of before, during and after the Event.

item.title: Indra's Net
item.content:encoded:
Indra's net by Rajiv Malhotra

A boundless network of multifaceted jewels (at each vertex) and each jewel reflected in all of the other jewels. A philosophical discourse on Hinduism.

item.title: Being different
item.content:encoded:
Being different by Rajiv Malhotra

Order vs Chaos. Comparing and contrasting Abrahamic religions with Dharmic traditions from an Indic lens.

item.title: Autobiography of a Yogi
item.content:encoded:
Autobiography of a Yogi by Paramahansa Yogananda

A bilateral introduction to spirituality containing both elementary insights and profound notions. A relevant reference to both the novice and the accomplished.

item.title: Ready, study, Go!
item.content:encoded:
Ready, study, Go! by Kurshed Batliwala & Dinesh Ghodke

A holistic path towards learning. The process of learning deconstructed and explained from the POV of a layman.

item.title: Homo Deus - A Brief History of Tomorrow
item.content:encoded:
Homo Deus - A Brief History of Tomorrow by Yuval Noah Harari

What after homo sapiens? Visualising and contemplating the progression of humanity through a conglomeration of social, political, cultural and scientific lenses.

item.title: A Brief History of Time
item.content:encoded:
A Brief History of Time by Stephen Hawking

Classic primer of astrophysics. Relativity.

item.title: How to Solve It
item.content:encoded:
How to Solve It by G. Pólya

How to do math! The intricacies behind the abstractions.

item.title: Chaos
item.content:encoded:
Chaos by James Gleick

An elucidation of the mathematics behind causality of tornadoes seeded by the flap of a butterfly's wings. Also, fractals and the Mandelbrot set!

item.title: The Selfish Gene
item.content:encoded:
The selfish gene by Richard Dawkins

Who is in control? We believe we are in control of our lives...We can't possibly be further away from the truth.

item.title: Art of thinking clearly
item.content:encoded:
Art of thinking clearly by Rolf Dobelli

Millennia of evolution and conditioning has defined the way we think. Learn how to deconstruct it to elicit lucidity.

item.title: Think like Da Vinci
item.content:encoded:
Think like Da Vinci by Michael J. Gelb

First principles. Curiosità, Dimostrazione, Sensazione, Sfumato, Arte/Scienza, Corporalita, Connessione.

item.title: The Tao of physics
item.content:encoded:
The Tao of physics by Fritjof Capra

Modern physics meets eastern mysticism. Zen powered Quantum mechanics!

item.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
item.content:encoded:
The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck by Mark Manson

Life bestows a finite number of fucks to be given everyday. Choose wisely where/to whom you give them (if you let something bother you, you gave a fuck)

item.title: Sapiens - A Brief History of Humankind
item.content:encoded:
Sapiens - A Brief History of Humankind by Yuval Noah Harari

Who are we, where do we come from? Where are we headed as a species?
